subject: Aegon Is Coming...
event:
... tomorrow morning.

 We're putting up a sample from THE WORLD OF ICE AND FIRE on my website, to join the samples from the next Wild Cards book (LOWBALL) and of course from WINDS OF WINTER (Mercy).  It's a short excerpt from the section of Aegon's Conquest, complete with some kickass art.

And by the way, those of you who read only this Live Journal  -- and there are a lot of you -- should check out my actual website some time.  There's loads of interesting material there, from news stories to biography and bibliography and sections on my toy knights.

Anyway, do hope you all enjoy the Aegon piece.  It will be up on the morrow.

props.taglist: world of ice and fire, website

comments.article: Here's hoping we don't all break the interwebs again tomorrow! ;)
comments.subject: Lookin' forward!

comments.article: Checkin' it since it was a very pink site) Just keep it goin'.

Yay, thank you so much! I am so looking forward to the World of Ice and Fire. It's definitely on my priority to buy list. Tempted to go preorder it right now as Amazon UK has it on sale.

Also, I wanted to ask if you had any comments on Stannis as compared to the Duke of Wellington? His northern campaign is of course reminiscent of Napoleon's Russian campaign but in terms of personality Stannis puts me very much in mind of the Iron Duke himself. I wondered if any of that is intentional?

I am really excited for World of Ice and Fire. I worked at a Barnes and Noble when Dangerous Women came out and immediately began recommending it for customers who were buying ASOIAF. Try not to forget to smell the roses, GRRM. After all, they're growing strong. Face palm.
This is monstrous good news, and will give me something to read and digest over Easter.  Thanks GRRM!
comments.subject: The gift that keeps on giving

comments.article:
oooh, more Targ goodness!

I check your site on occasion, but not as frequently as your (Not a ) Blog. Your section on toy knights inspired me to help plan battles in my own series by digging out some of my '90s Castle soldiers and knights. It's one thing to think of it, but as a model storyboard to help visualization positioning, it helps quite a bit.

The toy knight section is great - always an insperation and gives me an excuse to buy more.

Always look forward to new additions.

My collection runs from old plastic Marx to the newest pre-paints - just buy what I like.

Plenty of wargame figures too...

TomT
comments.subject: Toy Knights

comments.article: I love you
Really looking forward to a small taste :)
comments.subject: Excited

comments.article: I hope they go into more detail at the Vale. It's been so long since we've heard about the happenings at the Vale.
comments.subject: The Vale

comments.article: I love reading your fake history. The World of Ice and Fire can't come soon enough!
comments.subject: Excellent news!

comments.article:
Mr. Martin,
I am so happy to hear this i am so excited for TWOIAF!!!
and no i am not going to ask you about TWOW. I just want to say that i really enjoy all of your work and a response would be greatly appreciated.
comments.subject: Amazing

comments.article:
I admit, I am guilty of coming here and rarely going to the site. But I've now bookmarked the site and placed it on my quick-bar, which will motivate me to check it out more.

Also, AWESOME! Ever since watching ComicBookGirl19's ASOIAF history videos, I've been obsessed with Aegon's Conquest. Bring it on. My body is ready.
comments.subject: Bookmarked the website

comments.article:
Mr. Martin,
I just wanted to say that i really love your work. I would really appreciate a response from you. It would mean the world to me!!
comments.subject: Amazing

comments.article: *-*Ow, George! ♥

I loved the sequence of Bran's visions this Sunday. The dragon shadow cast over Kings Landing was especially nice, a haunting flashback or perhaps an image of the future.

Many fans like myself would love to see a few episodes open up with a pre-credit flashback of major or minor events that would serve as a history lesson but mainly a bit of foreshadowing to the episode itself.
comments.subject: More History the Show Should Use

comments.article: Cool.  Cool cool cool.
I was just wondering whether you could answer this question. Will the First Long Night be covered in the World of Ice and Fire?
comments.subject: World of Ice and Fire?

comments.article: I already spent a lot of time on visiting your homepage because there is so much interesting material. I especially enjoy the "What I´m reading" category-inspirational for getting to know new authors or/and books!
comments.subject: Your Homepage

comments.article: Sadly, I have not had time to update What I'm Reading for several years.  One day, I hope... I have read some great stuff lately.  The new Bernard Corwell THE PAGAN LORD and the new Joe Abercrombie HALF A KING top the list.
comments.subject: Re: Your Homepage

comments.article: Speaking of Wildcards (hey, you did, tangentially, haha), is there an official release date for Lowball?  The Wildcards sample on your site says coming Summer 2014, but Amazon lists a release date of Nov 4, 2014....but then again, Amazon doesn't even have the cover up, so I'm not sure how up to date that is.

comments.upictitle: ryan, diesel, ty johnson, dirk vargas, ect.. ect..: Syd
comments.article: Pretty pumped to dive into A WORLD OF ICE AND FIRE when it's released in October, a birthday gift I'll buy myself. Hoping it includes some mention of Ned Stark's mother, because I don't remember her ever being mentioned in the books.

I do have your web site bookmarked. Honest. But I also receive LiveJournal alerts.

Thank you for the head's up.
I pre ordered AWOIAF the 1st time, then the date changed, so I pre ordered it again.  can't wait!!!  thank you for all you do and you DO a lot!
To get back at all those fans who are hounding you to "finish the novels"; you should start writing more Haviland Tuf stories instead. That'll show 'em. :-)
comments.subject: Suggestion...

comments.article:
It would be more than an honor but a dream come thru if you could make an appearance in my book signing event in Houston next year.

I know it is more than likely impossible but I would rather failed knowing I tried than fail without making the effort.

Here is my e-mail
info@winesandlabelsproductions.com


Stay warm Winter is coming .

Kind Regards,

Linnette
comments.subject: Book Signing in Houston

comments.article:
What? Navigate from LJ?! OK...

There is a quote on there (website) by you (imagine) that I love. It reminds me to write every day. Even if it's nonsense. Thank you. </p>

Looking forward to this!
